TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit EventBindingService extends System.Object implements class System.ComponentModel.Design.IEventBindingService

Docs.summary: A default implementation of the interface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks By providing a service for registering event handlers for component events, <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.EventBindingService> provides a way to link an event handler with a component event from designer code.

Docs.permission: for full access to system resources. Demand values: , . Associated state:

Docs.param: The service provider from which will query for services.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: protected abstract string CreateUniqueMethodName (System.ComponentModel.IComponent component, System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor e);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance string CreateUniqueMethodName(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component, class System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor e) cil managed

Docs.param: The component for which the method name will be created.
The event to create a name for.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The name returned by the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.EventBindingService.CreateUniqueMethodName%2A> method must be compatible with the script language being used and it must not conflict with any other name in your code.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void FreeMethod (System.ComponentModel.IComponent component, System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor e, string methodName);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void FreeMethod(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component, class System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor e, string methodName) cil managed

Docs.param: The component to which the method is bound.
The for the event handler.
The name of the method to be freed.
Docs.summary: Provides a notification that a particular method is no longer being used by an event handler.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Some implementations may intend to remove the event hander when no events are using it. By overriding <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.EventBindingService.UseMethod%2A> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.EventBindingService.FreeMethod%2A>, an implementation can infer when a method is no longer needed.

MemberSignature.Value: protected abstract System.Collections.ICollection GetCompatibleMethods (System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor e);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.ICollection GetCompatibleMethods(class System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor e) cil managed

Docs.param: The containing the compatible delegate.
Docs.summary: Returns a collection of names of compatible methods.
Docs.returns: A collection of strings that are names of compatible methods.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Each string returned in the collection is the method name of a method whose signature is compatible with the delegate contained in `e`. <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.EventBindingService.GetCompatibleMethods%2A> should return an empty collection if no names are compatible.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.EventBindingService.ShowCode%2A> method does not display any particular code; generally it displays the last code the user typed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.EventBindingService.ShowCode%2A> method displays the body of the user code with the given method name.

Docs.param: The method name to validate.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default implementation does nothing. You may override this and throw an exception if the name is invalid for your use.
